presenter.bio: Session 3: Debate on Endoscopic Intervention in Biliary Disease - Suspected CBD stoneEUS first

slide.title: Session 3: Debate on Endoscopic Intervention in Biliary Disease - Suspected CBD stone EUS first
slide.titleNormalized: session 3: debate on endoscopic intervention in biliary disease - suspected cbd stone eus first
slide.text: Session 3: Debate on Endoscopic Intervention in Biliary Disease - Suspected CBD stone EUS first Hsiu-Po Wang MD National Taiwan University Hospital

slide.title: Choledocholithiasis
slide.text: Choledocholithiasis occurring among 15% to 20% of patients with gallbladder stones 1% to 5% patients who have undergone cholecystectomy have retained or recurrent bile duct stones Am J Surg 1989;158:171-3

Failure to identify CBD stones can result in recurrent symptoms, cholangitis, and repeated biliary pancreatitis Over-diagnosis may lead to unnecessary interventions such as ERCP or surgery and complications

slide.title: Diagnosis and treatment of choledocholithiasis - ERCP
slide.titleNormalized: diagnosis and treatment of choledocholithiasis - ercp
slide.text: Diagnosis and treatment of choledocholithiasis - ERCP ERCP with or without sphincterotomy - complications Pancreatitis Bleeding Perforation Selection of patients who will benefit from ERCP is important.

slide.title: Choledocholithiasis
slide.text: Choledocholithiasis TA US/CT MRCP EUS ERCP ERCP ERCP ERCP not sufficiently sensitive EUS superior to MRCP Radiology 1986;161:133-4. Radiology 1986;160:39-42. Am J Roentgenol 1984;142:729-33. Radiology 1987;162:419-24. Gastrointest Endosc 1999;49:26-31
When MRCP is negative, EUS is recommended to check for small CBD stones. European Journal of Radiology 54 (2005) 271–275
EUS ERCP STONE
Gastrointest Endosc 2010; 71: 1-9
Gastrointest Endosc 2010; 71: 1-9 A suggested management algorithm for patients with symptomatic cholelithiasis based on the degree of probability for choledocholithiasis

CT scan on D1: No stones No biliary dilation D1 T-Bil (mg/dL) 2.32 D-Bil (mg/dL) 1.24 AST (U/L) 1164 ALT (U/L) 783 Alk-P (U/L) 153 r-GT (U/L) 654 73-year-old lady with weakness and without fever Intermediate

EUS was more sensitive than ERC for stones<4 mm. Gastrointest Endosc 2009;69:244-52 Dx efficacy

slide.notes: 23 high risk only, 8 high risk ERCP)
slide.notesNormalized: 23 high risk only, 8 high risk ercp)
slide.notesHtml: 23 high risk only, 8 high risk ERCP)
slide.text: Dx efficacy Gastrointest Endosc 2008;67:660-8 In 23 cases of high risk group, only 8 cases were converted to ERCP after EUS. In other words, EUS-based strategy avoid 65% unnecessary ERCP in high risk group.
In high-risk patients, starting with EUS might be a preferred strategy, as 48% of patients have negative studies. Journal of Gastroenterology and Hepatology 23 (2008) 741–745

slide.text: NTUH 2011/1 to 2019/8 (2932 cases for ERCP lithotripsy) High Likelihood 51 patients (48%) Moderate Likelihood 54 patients (50%) Low likelihood 2 patients (2%) CBD stone in EUS 29 23 0 No CBD stone in EUS 22 (43.1%) 31 2 EUS-based strategy –NTUH 2011/1 to 2019/8

slide.title: EUS-based strategy avoided unnecessary ERCP
slide.text: EUS-based strategy avoided unnecessary ERCP Eur J Gastroenterol Hepatol 2011;23:367–374 Safety
Safety Gastrointest Endosc 2008;67:660-8
British Journal of Surgery 2009; 96: 967–974 Meta-analysis of over-all complication risk after EUS-guided ERCP versus ERCP alone Safety

slide.title: Cost-effectiveness – stratification of risk group
slide.text: Cost-effectiveness – stratification of risk group EUS-based ERCP was cost-effective in intermittent risk group of choledocholithiasis ERCP alone was cost-effective in high risk group of choledocholithiasis Am J Gastroenterol 2001; 96: 2892–2899. Gastrointest Endosc 2003; 57: 510–518. Gastrointest Endosc 2008; 67: T1513 Cost

slide.notes: The complication rate of EUS was significantly lower than diagnostic ERCP. An EUS-based strategy costs less than diagnostic ERCP in patients with low, moderate, or intermediate risk.
slide.notesNormalized: the complication rate of eus was significantly lower than diagnostic ercp. an eus-based strategy costs less than diagnostic ercp in patients with low, moderate, or intermediate risk.

slide.text: Gastrointest Endosc 1998;47:439-48 Cost Cost was significantly lower for an EUS-based strategy compared with an ERCP-based strategy in low and moderate/indeterminate risk groups
Gastrointest Endosc 2019;89:1075-105

Microlithiasis/sludge - Repeated pancreatitis (idiopathic) Stone migration before ERCP Downgrade of likelihood of choledocholithiasis Biliary biochemical test becomes normal Results of image studies seem negative

66 year-old lady with RUQ pain And nausea/vomiting for 5 days D10 T-Bil (mg/dL) 0.38 ALT (U/L) 8 r-GT (U/L) 15 Lipase (U/L) 89

Biliary sludge and microlithiasis should be excluded in all patients with repeated idiopathic pancreatitis and an intact gallbladder, Data also suggests its importance for those with a single idiopathic attack Br J Surg 2000;87:1650-5. Gastrointest Endosc 2004;60:673-8.

slide.title: EUS is better than ERC for diagnosis of biliary microlithiasis
slide.titleNormalized: eus is better than erc for diagnosis of biliary microlithiasis
slide.text:
EUS is better than ERC for diagnosis of biliary microlithiasis ERC was normal in 14% patients with EUS (+) - with a median CBD stone size of 2.1 mm
If according to ERC findings only, 10% remained untreated (<4 mm in diameter). If according to EUS findings only, 0.8% treated unnecessarily and 6 % untreated. Endoscopy 2003; 35: 411–415 Lancet 1996; 347:75-79

slide.title: Repeated pancreatitis , GB stone(+)
slide.text: Repeated pancreatitis , GB stone(+) EUS can detect the cause of repeated pancreatitis other than stones

12 year-old girl suffered from cholecystitis and pancreatitis D1 T-Bil (mg/dL) 7.67 D-Bil (mg/dL) 4.66 AST (U/L) 213 ALT (U/L) 365 Alk-P (U/L) 563 r-GT (U/L) 292 Lipase (U/L) 2832 Amylase (U/L) 1150 High risk

slide.title: ERCP for acute biliary pancreatitis
slide.text: ERCP for acute biliary pancreatitis potential to cause further damage prevalence of residual choledocholithiasis in ABP is low (< 30%) Gastrointest Endosc 2019;89:1075-105 EUS before ERCP?

slide.title: Conclusion
slide.text: Conclusion EUS-based strategy is favored according to the issues of efficacy, safety and cost-effectiveness in intermediate/low likelihood of CBD stones . According to ASGE proposal, ERCP can undergo directly in the patients with high likelihood of CBD stones . However, some studies showed EUS before ERCP could exclude the necessity of ERCP. EUS-based strategy should be considered for the possibility of microlithiasis /sludge of repeated idiopathic pancreatitis or possibility of stone passing before ERCP

slide.title: Thanks for your attention!
slide.text: Thanks for your attention!
